intro: Plagiogyria tuberculata, commonly known as the rough-stemmed starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided and have a distinctive rough texture. Plagiogyria tuberculata is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local insect populations.
